title: Supply and Demand Analysis
description: This topic explores the foundational concepts of supply and demand curves, examining how these curves facilitate equilibrium and efficient resource allocation in markets. Students will learn to analyze the impacts of governmental interventions, such as taxes and subsidies, on market outcomes.

title: Consumer Theory and Demand
description: Focusing on consumer behavior, this section delves into the derivation of demand curves and evaluates how shifts in price affect consumer welfare. The analysis involves understanding how consumers optimize utility given budget constraints and market conditions.

title: Producer Theory and Cost Analysis
description: This topic covers the intricacies of producer behavior by exploring production functions and cost structures. Students will analyze how firms optimize production processes and make decisions about output levels, with a focus on cost minimization and profit maximization.

title: Market Structures and Competition
description: Students will investigate various market structures, including perfect competition, monopoly, and monopsony. This section highlights the differences in market outcomes and firm behavior under each structure, discussing implications for efficiency and consumer welfare.

title: Equilibrium Analysis and Comparative Statics
description: This topic introduces equilibrium analysis in market settings and examines how markets adjust to changes in external conditions through comparative statics. Students will learn methods to predict and quantify changes in market equilibrium resulting from shifts in demand or supply.
